    1. attack(Actor, Actor, GameMap)

Interface Weapon

All Known Implementing Classes:
BareFist, BareFist, IntrinsicWeapon, WeaponItem
public interface Weapon
Interface for weapon items. Since an actor may decide to attack its target using its intrinsic weapon or a weapon item, some actions may accept an instance of Weapon instead of a WeaponItem or an IntrinsicWeapon

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    attack(Actor attacker, Actor target, GameMap map)
    This method is used to define how the weapon attacks its target For example, some weapons deals fire damage when the target is attacked.

  • Method Details

    • attack

      String attack(Actor attacker, Actor target, GameMap map)
      This method is used to define how the weapon attacks its target For example, some weapons deals fire damage when the target is attacked. This method can also be used to determine whether the attack lands (e.g. whether the chance to hit is met), the weapon's damage (e.g. Dragonslayer greatsword deals 100 damage to its target), and the weapon's verb (e.g. slashes, pierces, etc.)
      Parameters:
      attacker - the actor who performed the attack
      target - the actor who is the target of the attack
      map - the map on which the attack was executed
      Returns:
      the description of what the weapon did when the attack was performed
